chargeHist.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime
Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Paul D. Loucks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Send Obscene Email Messages, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 944.25(2).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Refrain from conduct which constitutes a violation of the criminal laws of any state of the United States or ordinances substantially conforming to a criminal statute.
Remain subject to terms and conditions of bond.
Successfully complete term of probation.

Supervision fees
DOC to treat as sex offense probation
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Paul D. Loucks

records.addlTxt: 4:03 p.m. Defendant Paul D. Loucks in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Schiek statement to compliance. State moves to dismiss - Granted. Adj. 4:04 p.m .

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: No contact with females under the age of 18 unless supervised other then for own children, may not use any device with internet capability other then work computer for employment purposes, may not possess firearms.

4:16 p.m. Defendant Paul D. Loucks in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Also calling 14cv282.  State moves to amend Count 2 to 944.25(2) - Class A Misdemeanor and Add Count 3 - 947.01 - Class B MIsdemeanor - Granted. State files DPA. Plea questionaire filed. Defendant pleads no contest to all charges.    Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists but will defer judgment on Count 1 and accepts DPA. Review date to be set for 2018. Schiek/Laufenberg/Defendant/Court statements to sentencing.
As to Counts 2 and 3, Court Sentence
WHS/POP 2 yrs
Fine $250 plus costs on each count
DOC to treat as sex offense probation 
3 days time served credit
Any conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO 
Appeal rights given
Fines/Costs to be taken from bond posted - any refund of cash bond to be refunded to poster.
Signature bond modified as to Count 1 - $10,000 sig bond with same conditions as cash bond
As to vehicle that is subject of 14cv282 -- vehicle is forfeited - DA to provide order.
Adj. 4:51 p.m.

01:53 pm - Defendant Paul D. Loucks in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also calling 14cv282.  Schiek states just in receipt of psycho/sexual eval - has not had time to review.  Joint requests for another pretrial date.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

1:53 p.m. Defendant Paul D. Loucks in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Michael Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Schiek statement- defendant has scheduled appts.; waiting for report. Laufenberg statement-examination scheduled. Counsel agree to adjournment. Court statement. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

04:03 pm - Defendant Paul D. Loucks in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also calling 14cv282.  Schiek states has had plea discussions with defense - resolution has not yet been worked out.  Joint request for adjournment.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

03:50 pm - Defendant Paul D. Loucks in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also calling 14cv282.   Laufenberg in receipt of Information, waives reading and enters a not guilty plea.  In 14cv282 a continuance is requested.  CV case to track criminal case.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 13, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

8:23 a.m. Defendant Paul D. Loucks in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Steven Mitchell Michlig, Asst. D.A. appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Waiver of Preliminary Examination filed. Defendant waives preliminary hearing; waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Bond continued.  Arraignment scheduled for November 17, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

No contact with females under the age of 18 unless supervised other then for own children, may not use any device with internet capability other then work computer for employment purposes, may not possess firearms.

01:32 pm - Defendant Paul D. Loucks in court, via video, with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Defendant Paul D. Loucks in custody.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading - set for preliminary hearing.  Schiek/Laufenberg to bond.  Court sets cash bond.  Prelim time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 24, 2014 at 08:15 am.
